member.summary: LlamaSharp implementation of the AI provider base class. Provides text generation, embeddings, chat completion and vision capabilities using the LlamaSharp library.

member.summary: Boolean indicating if the engine is disposed.

member.name: P:SharpAI.Engines.LlamaSharpEngine.EmbeddingDimensions
member.summary: Gets the number of dimensions in the embedding vectors generated by this engine. Returns -1 if not yet determined, 0 if embeddings are not supported.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this engine supports GPU acceleration. LlamaSharp supports GPU acceleration when CUDA is available.

member.name: P:SharpAI.Engines.LlamaSharpEngine.SupportsEmbeddings
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this engine supports generating embeddings. Support depends on whether the embedder was successfully initialized.

member.name: P:SharpAI.Engines.LlamaSharpEngine.SupportsGeneration
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this engine supports text generation. LlamaSharp always supports text generation.

member.name: P:SharpAI.Engines.LlamaSharpEngine.IsInitialized
member.summary: Gets whether this engine has been successfully initialized.

member.name: M:SharpAI.Engines.LlamaSharpEngine.GetContextSize
member.summary: Gets the context window size (maximum number of tokens) for this model.
member.returns: The context window size in tokens, or -1 if not available.

member.summary: Count tokens in using the provider's tokenizer.
member.param: Whether to include a beginning-of-sentence token.
member.returns: Total token count; 0 if the engine is not initialized.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LlamaSharpEngine class.
member.param: Optional logging module for capturing debug and error information. If null, a new LoggingModule will be created.

member.name: M:SharpAI.Engines.LlamaSharpEngine.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the LlamaSharpEngine. Properly disposes of the model, context, and embedder instances.

member.name: M:SharpAI.Engines.LlamaSharpEngine.InitializeAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the LlamaSharp engine with the specified model file. Loads the model, creates context, and sets up executors for text generation and embeddings.
member.param: The file path to the GGUF model file to load.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous initialization operation.
member.exception: Thrown when the model fails to load or initialize.

member.summary: Determines the optimal number of GPU layers to use based on available hardware.

member.name: T:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat
member.summary: Defines common chat/prompt formats used by different language models. Each format has specific tokens and structure that the model was trained to recognize.

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.Simple
member.summary: Simple role-based format using "role: content" structure. Compatible with many base models and general-purpose LLMs.
member.example: system: You are a helpful assistant. user: What is 2+2? assistant: 4 user: Why? assistant:

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.ChatML
member.summary: ChatML (Chat Markup Language) format used by OpenAI models and many modern LLMs. Uses special tokens: <|im_start|>, <|im_end|>
member.example: <|im_start|>system You are a helpful assistant.<|im_end|> <|im_start|>user What is 2+2?<|im_end|> <|im_start|>assistant 4<|im_end|> <|im_start|>user Why?<|im_end|> <|im_start|>assistant

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.Llama2
member.summary: Llama 2 Chat format with instruction tags. Uses [INST], [/INST] tags and <<SYS>> for system prompts.
member.example:
<s>[INST] <<SYS>> You are a helpful assistant. <</SYS>>
What is 2+2? [/INST] 4 </s><s>[INST] Why? [/INST]

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.Llama3
member.summary: Llama 3 format with header-based structure. Uses header IDs and special tokens for role demarcation.
member.example:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>
You are a helpful assistant.<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>
What is 2+2?<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.Alpaca
member.summary: Alpaca instruction format using ### markers. Commonly used by instruction-tuned models based on LLaMA.
member.example:
### System: You are a helpful assistant.
### Instruction: What is 2+2?
### Response: 4
### Instruction: Why?
### Response:

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.Mistral
member.summary: Mistral/Mixtral instruction format. Uses [INST] tags similar to Llama 2 but with simpler structure.
member.example: <s>[INST] What is 2+2? [/INST] 4</s>[INST] Why? [/INST]

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.HumanAssistant
member.summary: Human/Assistant conversational format. Used by Anthropic's Claude and some other conversational models.
member.example:
Human: What is 2+2?
Assistant: 4
Human: Why?
Assistant:

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.Zephyr
member.summary: Zephyr model format with role tags. Uses <|role|> tags with </s> as separators.
member.example: <|system|> You are a helpful assistant.</s> <|user|> What is 2+2?</s> <|assistant|> 4</s> <|user|> Why?</s> <|assistant|>

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.Phi
member.summary: Phi model format used by Microsoft's Phi series. Uses specific instruction and response markers.
member.example: Instruct: What is 2+2? Output: 4 Instruct: Why? Output:

member.name: F:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatFormat.DeepSeek
member.summary: DeepSeek model format. Similar to simple format but with specific markers.
member.example:
User: What is 2+2?
Assistant: 4
User: Why?
Assistant:

member.name: T:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatMessage
member.summary: Represents a chat message with role, content, and timestamp information. Used for building conversation histories in chat completion scenarios.

member.name: P:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatMessage.Role
member.summary: Gets or sets the role of the message sender. Common values include "system", "user", and "assistant".

member.name: P:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatMessage.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the message. Contains the actual text content of the chat message.

member.name: P:SharpAI.Prompts.ChatMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the timestamp when the message was created. Defaults to the current UTC time when the ChatMessage instance is created.

member.summary: Represents a chat message with role, content, and timestamp information. Used for building conversation histories in chat completion scenarios.

Answer:

Story:

Language: Python Task: Implement a binary search algorithm

Title: The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Healthcare Type: Research Summary
Abstract:

Create a list of 10 creative business ideas for sustainable technology:
1.

Complete the following template:
Subject: [TOPIC] Dear [RECIPIENT],
I am writing to inform you about

Characters: Alice (scientist), Bob (journalist) Setting: Research laboratory Topic: New discovery
Alice:
